title: Enel Will Return in the Final Saga
theoryText: Based on Enel's departure to the moon in Episode 193 and recent manga revelations, fans theorize that Enel will return during One Piece's final saga. The theory gained traction after Chapter 1114 revealed hieroglyphs that match what Enel discovered on the moon during his cover story, particularly imagery related to the Mother Flame. Since the moon's ancient civilization appears connected to the Void Century and the series' ultimate mysteries, Enel's knowledge from the moon could make him relevant to the endgame.
author: Multiple fans across platforms

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains major manga spoilers including revelations from Chapter 1114 about the Mother Flame and connections to ancient civilizations

popularity.description: One of the most commonly discussed theories regarding Enel, though some fans are tired of hearing about it

evidence: Enel's cover story shows him discovering ancient moon civilization hieroglyphs
Chapter 1114 reveals imagery matching Enel's moon discoveries
The Mother Flame connection suggests moon lore is relevant to the final saga
Enel is one of the few major antagonists left alive with unfinished business
His Goro Goro no Mi is stated to be one of the strongest devil fruits
counterEvidence: Enel's story may be complete as a cautionary tale about god complexes
Oda may not want to revisit every past antagonist
The moon connection could be explored through other means

title: The 'Endless Vearth' Enel Seeks Is Not The Moon
theoryText: Some fans theorize that the 'Fairy Vearth' or 'Endless Earth' that Enel seeks is not actually the moon, but rather the sunken continent from the Void Century. This theory suggests that Enel's journey to the moon was a misdirection, and he may eventually discover that the true 'endless earth' lies beneath the ocean, possibly connected to the revelation that the world's sea level rose 200 meters during the Void Century.
author: Worstgen forum users

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Contains spoilers about the sunken continent and Void Century revelations from recent manga chapters

popularity.description: Less popular alternative theory to the Enel return theory

evidence: Recent manga revelations about the world's sea level rising 200 meters
The concept of a sunken continent with vast landmass
Thematic connection between Sky Island (too high) and sunken lands (too low)
counterEvidence: Enel clearly departed for the moon in Episode 193
The cover story confirms he reached the moon
No narrative setup for Enel to discover the sunken continent theory
The moon has already provided significant lore through the cover story

title: Cricket's Hearing the Bell Proves Long-Distance Sound Travel in One Piece
theoryText: Fans have theorized that the Golden Bell's sound traveling from Sky Island (10,000 meters up) all the way down to Jaya demonstrates that sound can travel extraordinary distances in the One Piece world. This could have implications for other world-building elements, such as the potential for ancient communication systems, the Voice of All Things, or how information traveled in ancient times before Den Den Mushi.
author: One Piece community

popularity.description: Minor observation rather than major theory

evidence: The Golden Bell's sound clearly reaches Jaya from 10,000 meters
The bell was specifically designed to be heard from great distances
One Piece physics often differ from real-world physics
counterEvidence: The Golden Bell is magical/special, not representative of normal sound
This could simply be artistic license for emotional impact
No other examples of similar long-distance sound travel

title: Skypiea's Resolution Foreshadows Series-Wide Peace
theoryText: The resolution of the 400-year war between Skypieans and Shandians in Episode 193 is theorized to foreshadow the eventual resolution of the series' larger conflicts. Just as two peoples who fought for centuries found peace through understanding, truth, and the actions of an outside mediator (Luffy), the theory suggests that the final saga will see similar reconciliation between the World Government and its opponents, pirates and marines, or other long-standing conflicts in the One Piece world.
author: One Piece community

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theoretical endgame speculation but no concrete spoilers

evidence: Skypiea demonstrates Oda's interest in showing conflict resolution
The arc emphasizes themes of truth, understanding, and peace
Luffy consistently acts as a catalyst for positive change
One Piece frequently uses earlier arcs to foreshadow later themes
The series has emphasized dreams of freedom and peace
counterEvidence: The series may end with revolution rather than reconciliation
Some conflicts may be too deep for peaceful resolution
Oda may choose a different thematic resolution
